page_title: Withdrawing from vs. Dropping a Course
policy_summary: The deadlines to add/drop and withdraw from courses are posted on the Academic Calendar . Please note that non-full term courses such as short courses have special deadlines (also noted on the Academic Calendar).

rows.Withdrawing from a Course: The action of withdrawing from a course is taken after the add/drop courses deadline.
rows.Dropping a Course: Dropping a course refers to having the course removed from the student's schedule before the add/drop deadline.

rows.Withdrawing from a Course: The student is responsible for any tuition and/or fees associated with the course.
rows.Dropping a Course: The student will not be charged any tuition and/or fees associated with the course.

rows.Withdrawing from a Course: Withdrawn credits count toward the student's total maximum credit hours.
rows.Dropping a Course: The removed credits do not count toward the student's maximum credit hours.

rows.Withdrawing from a Course: A letter grade of 'W' is assigned to the withdrawn course and is visible on the transcript.
rows.Dropping a Course: Since the course is entirely removed, the course will not show up on the student's transcript.

rows.Withdrawing from a Course: The student's GPA is not affected.
rows.Dropping a Course: The student's GPA is not affected.
